articles.title: Artificial Intelligence, concrete steps
articles.description: When hype takes off, common sense knocks on the door. Today, artificial intelligence is the hype par excellence, and there are very good reasons for this enthusiasm. But what goals are we setting ourselves by using it?

articles.title: The impact of new generations on UX
articles.description: Are young people more accustomed to digital? Real. Should we expect more expert navigation? Absolutely not. The different propensity of these generations to purchase online compared to the past is clear to everyone, but it is worth thinking about the impact that this greater predisposition could have on the design of user experiences and the development of new digital products

articles.title: Design Thinking and the creativity of the programmer
articles.description: Let's definitively break the image of creatives and programmers. Creative ( /cre·a·tì·vo/ ): is he really an unruly subject who cooks ideas by trial and error? Programmer ( /pro·gram·ma·tó·re/ ): Is he really a cold planner with mathematical certainty?

articles.title: Apply Design Thinking? My daughter will explain it to you
articles.description: We often hear about Design Thinking in recent years. But what really happens in a Design Thinking process? Who is involved and how much effort and time does it require? Is it only applicable to large projects? We verified it with one of the most creative minds of this century: My daughter

articles.title: The role of the Designer in the time of Enterprise platforms
articles.description: We were amazed by the power of solid, structured solutions built for needs analyzed on large numbers. The role of Design has changed again, because redesigning a product in which such heavy investments have been made is a delicate issue. Very delicate.

articles.title: Let's take it lightly. Design Thinking: is UX a Post-it?
articles.description: Continuous Butt Exhibition, Write Big in a Small Square Task and Dirty wall Drama are just some of the topics to be resolved during a Design Thinking session, but they shouldn't worry us: the world of consultancy is creating architectures with walls made only of glass, walks with free selfie and coordinators who are increasingly agile in bending over. The future of innovation is bright.

articles.title: Gain experience to be able to design it
articles.description: Do we really want to limit this concept to the pleasant use of a platform or the improvement of its performance? It is certainly a good start, but the experience of those who use a digital platform cannot and must not depend only on the effective design of the interfaces and the resulting flows.

articles.title: User Experience: the one they tell you and the real one
articles.description: We tried to understand what was behind those magical words and we made them our own, with our working method: the BuonSenso Approach. Because in the daily challenge of work we encounter companies, with their complexity, their history, their constraints, their objectives and above all their people.
